org.apromore.plugin.property

Interface PropertyType<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of Property
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PluginPropertyType, RequestPropertyType

    public interface PropertyType<T>

    Defines a single Property of a Plugin. Contains both meta data (name, description, ..) and the value of the Property. Subclasses MUST provide a valid Object.equals(Object) and Object.hashCode() implementation, see PluginPropertyType for an example.

    Please not you should only use basic Java classes as properties, as properties often have to be converted to XML during Web Service invocation. InputStream is OK to use and will be shown as a file upload!

    Author:
    Felix Mannhardt (Bonn-Rhein-Sieg University oAS)

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        String getId()
        Identifier of the PropertyType. Two properties with the same identifier are "equal"!
        Returns:
        a unique identifier (across the Plugin) for this property

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns:
        the human readable name of this property (may be presented in UI)

      • getValueType

        Class<T> getValueType()
        Returns:
        the class of the properties value

      • isMandatory

        boolean isMandatory()
        Returns:
        if the property is required for the Plugin to work

      • getDescription

        String getDescription()
        Returns:
        the human readable description of this property (may be presented in UI)

      • getValue

        T getValue()
        Returns:
        the actual value, which always will be of the specified value type

      • setValue

        void setValue(T value)
        Parameters:
        value -

      • hasValue

        boolean hasValue()
        Returns:
        false if the value is NULL, true otherwise
